1: Give sentence upon me (O God) and defend my cause against the unholy people: Oh deliver me from the deceitful, and wicked man.
2: For thou (O God) art my strength: why hast thou shot me from thee? Why go I then so heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?
3: Oh send out thy light and thy truth, that they may lead me and bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy dwelling.
4: That I may go in to the altar of God, even unto the God which is my joy and pleasure, and upon the harp to give thanks unto thee, O God, my God.
5: Why art thou so heavy (O my soul) and why art thou so disquieted within me? O put thy trust in God, for I will yet give him thanks for the help of his countenance, and because he is my God.
